statement:
[**Theorem**]{} \[Markov - Kakutani\] [**-**]{} Let $X$ be a topological
vector space and $\mathcal{T}$ a commuting family of continuous linear
operators in $X$. Suppose $K$ is a compact convex subset of $X$ such
that

$$T(K) \subseteq K$$

for every $T \in \mathcal{T}$. Then there is a point $x_0 \in K$ such
that $Tx_0 = x_0$ for all $T \in \mathcal{T}$.
